name: Inline Code Demo: Hexagonal Grid
description: Demonstrates inline JavaScript execution. The AI wrote this JavaScript code directly in JSON, no pre-defined functions! The code runs on the client and generates 37 cylinders in a hexagonal pattern.

functionCalls.code: const objects = []; const rings = 3; const spacing = 2.5; for(let q=-rings; q<=rings; q++) { const r1 = Math.max(-rings, -q-rings); const r2 = Math.min(rings, -q+rings); for(let r=r1; r<=r2; r++) { const x = (Math.sqrt(3)*q + Math.sqrt(3)/2*r) * spacing; const z = (3/2*r) * spacing; objects.push({ id: `hex_${q}_${r}`, type: 'Cylinder', position: [x, 1, z], radius: 0.9, height: 0.8, mass: 2, rotation: [Math.PI/2, 0, 0], color: '#32cd32', restitution: 0.7, friction: 0.4 }); }} return objects;

metadata.author: Inline Code System
metadata.educationalNotes: This scene demonstrates the TRUE power of the system: The AI can write ANY JavaScript code directly in the scene JSON. No need for pre-defined functions! The code is executed on the client to generate the 37 cylinders. Want 100 spheres in a spiral? Just write the JavaScript! Want a fractal tree? Write the code! The possibilities are UNLIMITED.
